result.execSummary:
The defendant Maurice S Harper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Repeater, Second or Subsequent Offense, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)2.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Second or Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy. Any new monies deposited in prison account may be applied to fine/costs at rate by DOC.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.

Eligible for Substance Abuse Program after 8 years.
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration after 8 years.
Complete all alcohol and drug treatment that commenced in the prison system.
Sign release of information forms for offender's assessments, medication/pharmacy(ies) and/or treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety for the duration of supervision.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Fill all medications at one pharmacy.
Take medications only as prescribed by physician.
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Pay Child Support.
No contact, direct or indirect, with Ryan Duchaine.
No contact, direct or indirec,t with Kendra Trzebiatowski.
Submit DNA Sample if not completed.

9:13 AM Defendant Maurice S Harper appeared by phone, Attorney Robert J Jambois appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls the case.
Atty Jambois states appearances and indicates that this is a motion hearing.
Defendant indicates they are able to hear everyone speaking in the courtroom.
Court makes statements regarding the motion.
Defendant makes statements in support of the motion.
Court questions the defendant.
Defendant makes further statements.
Atty Jambois makes statements in opposition to the motion.
Court requests clarification regarding Atty Jambois' statements.

BY THE COURT:
Motion for sentence modification is denied for reasons stated on record.
Notice of Completion of Representation filed by Atty Michael Edward Covey

02:32 PM Defendant Maurice S Harper appeared by video from Racine Correctional and is pro se. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Beverly A Jambois appeared for State of Wisconsin. Motion for Sentence Modification.
ADA Jambois questions the defendant if he has received State's Response to Defendant's Motion for Sentence Modification.
It was filed two days ago and the defendant has not received.
Court questions the defendant for clarification.
Case is rescheduled.

11:28 AM Defendant Maurice S Harper appeared by video from Columbia Correctional Institution. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Robert J Jambois appeared in court for State of Wisconsin.  Motion to Modify Sentence filed by pro se defendant. 
Defendant states that the Judge on his Waushara cases didn't grant being eligible for the Substance Abuse program.  
ADA Jambois doesn't believe this court can change the Judge's decision for the Waushara County cases.  Waushara should have been aware of the sentence of the Portage case when sentenced in Waushara County. 
Defendant request that the Portage cases state if they are consecutive or concurrent with the Waushara County cases.   

  BY THE COURT:  The Portage County case was sentenced prior to the Waushara cases. Motion to Modify Sentence is denied.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Maurice S Harper in court with attorney John H. Wallace. Defendant Maurice S Harper in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation agent is also present.

9:41 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matter is set for a sentencing hearing today. Defendant entered pleas previously.
Court ordered a PSI.
Copies were forwarded to counsel.

State has no corrections from a factual standpoint.

Atty Wallace went through the PSI with his client, states one correction.

Neither counsel will be calling witnesses.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court prior to sentencing, makes sentence recommendations.
State has complied with victim notification statutes.
Restitution was not requested.

Atty Wallace addresses the Court prior to sentencing, makes sentence recommendations.

Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Determinate Prison Sentence for 15 Years
Initial Confinement for 10 Years
Extended Supervision for 5 Years
508 days jail credit
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program after 8 years
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration after 8 years
Conditions:
Complete all alcohol and drug treatment that commenced in the prison system
Complete an AODA assessment and comply with recommended treatment
Sign release of information forms for offender's assessments, medication/pharmacy(ies) and/or treatment
Maintain absolute sobriety for the duration of supervision
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription 
Fill all medications at one pharmacy
Take medications only as prescribed by physician
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
Obtain/maintain employment and/or schooling or a combination of both equal to fulltime
Pay Child Support
No contact, direct or indirect, with Ryan Duchaine
No contact, direct or indirec,t with Kendra Trzebiatowski
Pay costs
Pay DNA Sample
Submit DNA Sample if not completed
Any new monies deposited in prison account may be applied to fine/costs at rate by DOC

Count 3:
Determinate Prison Sentence for 15 Years
Initial Confinement for 10 Years
Extended Supervision for 5 Years
508 days jail credit
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration after 8 years
Concurrent to Count 1
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1
Pay Costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 4:
Determinate Prison Sentence for 15 Years
Initial Confinement for 10 Years
Extended Supervision for 5 Years
508 days jail credit
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration after 8 years
Concurrent to Count 1 and Count 3
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1 and Count 3
Pay Costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 5:
Determinate Prison Sentence for 15 Years
Initial Confinement for 10 Years
Extended Supervision for 5 Years
508 days jail credit
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration after 8 years
Concurrent to Count 1 and Count 3 and Count 4

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on April 21, 2017 at 09:30 am.

10:22 a.m. Defendant Maurice S Harper in court with attorney John H. Wallace. Defendant Maurice S Harper in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information is filed and reading is waived. Counts 2, 4 & 5 were amended.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Victim notification was complied with.
Court sets case aside to allow Atty Wallace time to discuss with his client.

10:47 a.m. Court back session:
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1: No Contest
Count 3: No Contest
Count 4: No Contest
Count 5: No Contest
Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Counts 1, 3, 4, & 5.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. Counts 2, 6, 7, & 8 are dismissed and read in.

BY THE COURT:***PSI REPORT ORDERED to be provided to the parties by April 14, 2017.
Bond is revoked  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 21, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Defense

Matter before the Court for a Motion Hearing on the State's Motion for Admission of Other Acts Evidence & Motion on Defendant Testifying.
ADA Cousins make states regarding Motions in Limine.
Court is ready to move forward with Motions in Limine.

Court questions Atty Wallace as to Motions 1 - 3.
Atty Wallace does not have any objections to the State's Motion in Limine 1-3.
Motion in Limine #4 is addressed byt the Court.
Atty Wallace objects.
ADA Cousins makes statements regarding Motion in Limine #4.
Atty Wallace makes statements regarding the 4th Motion in Limine.

BY THE COURT:
For reasons stated on the record, Motion in Limine #4 is granted.

ADA Cousins makes statements regarding the State's Motion for Admission of Other Acts Evidence.
Atty Wallace responds.
ADA Cousins replies.


BY THE COURT:
For reasons stated on the record, the State's Motion for Admission of Other Acts Evidence are granted in it's entirety.

ADA Cousins makes statements regarding other Motions.
Atty Wallace makes statements regarding other Motions.

BY THE COURT:  
Jury Trial is to continue as scheduled. Attys are to be in Court by 7:45 a.m. the morning of the Jury Trial for Pre-Trial Motions. Jury selection to start at 8:30 a.m. 23 Jurors to be seated in the Jury Box. Each Atty will have 5 strikes. 13 Jurors to be chosen with one serving as an alternate.
